source.name: float reading question
source.instructions: **From the lines of text below, drag ++two++ of them into answer space. Your answer should explain the difference between a float and an int.**
source.initial:
A float is a decimal number,
while an int is a whole number.
A float is a whole number, #distractor
while an int is a decimal number. #distractor
A float is an irrational number, #distractor
while an int is a rational number. #distractor
source.guidance: A floating point number is one with a decimal. An int is a whole number (or integer).
source.learningObjectives: SWBAT describe the difference between a float and an int
